item.title: Replication and Sharding
item.description: Setting the Stage for Distributed Storage Link to heading Non-distributed Storage (Single-Master System): Imagine a small, favorite coffee shop. Keeping track of customer names and preferences is manageable. A simple pad of paper acts as the database. New customer preferences are easily added or updated. This system is easy to understand and maintain (like a single-computer database). Challenges will arise as the coffee shop grows (scales) and this single-master system becomes inadequate.
